entry.title: HAAi: ‘Hey!’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
HAAi: ‘Hey!’

 Best New Music

Producer, songwriter, and DJ HAAi is busy putting the finishing touches on her new album, HUMANiSE (due Oct. 10 via Mute).

Sep. 2

entry.title: Kurt Vile & Luke Roberts: ‘classic love’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Kurt Vile & Luke Roberts: ‘classic love’

 Best New Music

Indie rock hit maker Kurt Vile just dropped Classic Love, a new five-track EP made in collaboration with his Nashville-based pal Luke Roberts .

Sep. 1

entry.title: Sierra Ferrell: ‘A Lesson in Leavin'’ (feat. Nikki Lane) (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Sierra Ferrell: ‘A Lesson in Leavin'’ (feat. Nikki Lane)

 Best New Music

“A Lesson in Leavin’” had an impromptu debut at Stagecoach Festival earlier this year and was simply too good to abandon in the desert.

Aug. 29

entry.title: Blake Mills & Pino Palladino: ‘Taka’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Blake Mills & Pino Palladino: ‘Taka’

 Best New Music

What happens when you pair a great guitar player with a badass bassist?

Aug. 28

entry.title: Men I Trust: ‘Come Back Down’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Men I Trust: ‘Come Back Down’

 Best New Music

Men I Trust are winding their way through the USA on their biggest tour yet.

Aug. 27

entry.title: Big Wild: ‘Too Loud’ (feat. Phantogram) (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Big Wild: ‘Too Loud’ (feat. Phantogram)

 Best New Music

In just a few days, Big Wild (aka Jackson Stell) will release the vibrant new album Wild Child (Aug. 29).

Aug. 26

entry.title: Gelli Haha: ‘Pluto is not a planet it’s a restaurant’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Gelli Haha: ‘Pluto is not a planet it’s a restaurant’

 Best New Music

LA-based sonic acrobat Gelli Haha takes a running leap into her arthouse theatrics with frisky energy to spare.

Aug. 25

entry.title: Ozomatli: ‘Red Line’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
entry.content:
Ozomatli: ‘Red Line’

 Best New Music

Ozomatli is a band of activists who use music as a weapon for confronting inequity on their new song “Red Line.”

Aug. 22
